casebody.data:
Rose Yeager BASSECHES, Appellant, v. PERPETUAL BUILDING ASSOCIATION, Appellee. No. 9974. United States Court of Appeals District of Columbia Circuit. Argued May 16, 1949. Decided July 5, 1949. Mr. Herman Miller, Washington, D. C., for appellant. Mr. Harry L. Ryan, Jr., Washington, D. C, with whom Mr. Roger J. Whiteford, Washington, D. C., was on the brief, for appellee.

Before EDGERTON and PROCTOR, Circuit Judges, and H. CHURCH FORD, District Judge sitting by designation.

PER CURIAM.

We find no substantial error in the record. The judgment of the District Court is therefore affirmed.
